alert.note: Alert for Berrien; Brooks; Lanier; Lowndes (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 5:37PM EDT until June 29 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Berrien County in south central Georgia... Northeastern Brooks County in south central Georgia... Lanier County in south central Georgia... Northern Lowndes County in south central Georgia... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 537 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Valdosta, Lakeland, Hahira, Ray City, Moody Air Force Base, I-75 At Exit 16, Remerton, Meigs, Morven, Barretts, I-75 At Exit 22, I-75 At Exit 29, Valdosta Regional Airport, Kinderlou, Teeterville, I-75 At Exit 11, Hansell, Barney and Courthouse. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
